issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Eustore relies on account name/alias in ARNs

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Eustore is unable to install images because it does not believe the current user is Eucalyptus/Admin. 

Looks like some fields have gotten re-org'd and the account id and account name have been swapped. Not sure if this was intentional, or if it is the cause of the fault. Eutester (also using boto) is still grabbing/displaying the correct fields. See command output below...
Thanks,
-M

{code}

[root@eucahost-51-76 crap]# euca-version 
euca2ools 2.1.3 (Limbo)
eucalyptus 3.3.0

[root@eucahost-51-76 crap]# euca_conf --get-credentials admin.zip --cred-user admin --cred-account eucalyptus

[root@eucahost-51-76 crap]# unzip admin.zip 
Archive:  admin.zip
To setup the environment run: source /path/to/eucarc
  inflating: eucarc                  
  inflating: iamrc                   
  inflating: cloud-cert.pem          
  inflating: jssecacerts             
  inflating: euca2-admin-2ece0bc4-pk.pem  
  inflating: euca2-admin-2ece0bc4-cert.pem  

[root@eucahost-51-76 crap]# . eucarc 

[root@eucahost-51-76 crap]# euare-userlistbypath 
arn:aws:iam::431623182688:user/admin

[root@eucahost-51-76 crap]# euare-accountlist
euare-policy-test-account 	337828249483
eucalyptus 	431623182688

[root@eucahost-51-76 crap]# eustore-install-image -i 0696716400 -k kvm -d /disk1/storage/ -b centos  --debug
2013-04-09 11:37:15,892 InstallImage [DEBUG]:request_params: {'kernel_type': 'kvm', 'bucket': 'centos', 'image_name': '0696716400', 'dir': '/disk1/storage/'}
2013-04-09 11:37:15,893 InstallImage [DEBUG]:Method: GET

2013-04-09 11:37:15,894 InstallImage [DEBUG]:establishing HTTP connection: kwargs={}
2013-04-09 11:37:15,894 InstallImage [DEBUG]:Token: None
2013-04-09 11:37:15,894 InstallImage [DEBUG]:using _calc_signature_2
2013-04-09 11:37:15,895 InstallImage [DEBUG]:query string: AWSAccessKeyId=8EDSOUFS4QVOP52AX4FF7&Action=GetUser&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-04-09T18%3A37%3A15Z&Version=2010-05-08
2013-04-09 11:37:15,895 InstallImage [DEBUG]:string_to_sign: GET
192.168.51.76:8773
/services/Euare/
AWSAccessKeyId=8EDSOUFS4QVOP52AX4FF7&Action=GetUser&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&SignatureVersion=2&Timestamp=2013-04-09T18%3A37%3A15Z&Version=2010-05-08

2013-04-09 11:37:15,940 InstallImage [DEBUG]:<GetUserResponse xmlns="http://iam.amazonaws.com/doc/2010-05-08/"><GetUserResult><User><Path>/</Path><UserName>admin</UserName><UserId>EGEHXW16EMDAMQJSP6UMS</UserId><Arn>arn:aws:iam::431623182688:user/admin</Arn></User></GetUserResult><ResponseMetadata><RequestId>e167a463-33e8-45ac-9cf1-7071b9ceeee9</RequestId></ResponseMetadata></GetUserResponse>
Error: must be cloud admin to upload kernel/ramdisk. try specifying existing ones with --kernel and --ramdisk


From eutester:

n [13]: tester.show_all_users()

comments.body: This should be taken care of in git. I uploaded a build for testing (euca2ools-3.0.0-0.9.alpha6.20130426git5d03079) here: http://repos.fedorapeople.org/repos/gholms/cloud/
